children.subject:
EE16a: Enrollment Messup

Hi,

I'm an EECS freshman who was previously enrolled in EE16a, but accidentally dropped the course when trying to switch a lab section. I am now waitlisted for the course, but I really need to get in because this is my only other technical besides CS61a. I realize I messed up big time, but is there any way I could be added back to the course (since I was orignially registered anyways)?

Thank you so much,

Kushagra
Please direct this question to the data science piazza or advisers. This is not related to EECS, CS, or the other tags you misused.

Declaring Data Science

I am planning to declare Data Science and have taken 61A and 61B to satisfy two of the prerequisites. I took math 54 when I was a freshman but No Passed it because I could not attend the final. I am currently enrolled in Math 54 again. Will my No Pass effect the GPA i need to declare? Will the grade I get this semester replace my No Pass in terms of declaration GPA?
This is definitely a question for the Data Science Piazza - DATA 001.

Prerequisites for Data Science

Does a 4 on the calc BC test allow me to test out of math 1a if I plan to declare data science? I'm taking math 1b and I don't know if I need to start from 1a.

Course Enrollment

I am a concurrent student, I am still in the pending in CS186. And I found that this course has capacity. Since there are only 3 days left, I am nervous about my course enrollment, my form id is 191666.

If anyone can help me. Thanks a lot!!

history.content:
Reposting this, as it's a little old now: 

Dear Students:

Beginning Monday, October 2, Piazza will no longer be used for general advising questions. However, we will continue to use this forum for departmental announcements, enrollment updates, and peer-directed correspondence. This platform has a lot of historical information that continues to be useful. Please use the search function to find quick answers to your questions. Also, use the discussions forum to post questions/comments/recommendations to your peers.

Advising staff will not be responding to questions through this forum. If you have advising questions, please communicate with the appropriate Undergraduate Major Advisor. Due to the growth of our student body, advising staff will not be responding to posts on Piazza.

Please consider one of the many following ways to communicate with an advisor.

For LSCS Students:

  • Refer to the FAQ's page;
  • Email cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu*; 
  • Go to drop-in advising hours for quick questions: Wed 10-noon & 1-4pm in 315, 377, or 379 Soda Hall
  • or Schedule an appointment in Cal Central

For EECS Students:

  • Email eecs-advising@eecs.berkeley.edu*;
  • Schedule an appointment here;
  • Meet with your ESS Advisor (schedule online or Wed drop-in)

*Note: the standard response time is 3-5 business days. 

tl;dr Due to the growth of our student body, advising staff will not be responding to posts on Piazza.
